115131.content:
"No, Fia, I'm Kelos!" the raven haired girl quickly spoke. "And that's actually your father!" Kelos pointed to Arthras. "He put a transformation potion in the drink!"

"Oh what an imagination you have little lady," Fia replied. Arthras chuckled at this, though it came out as a girlish giggle.

"It's true!" Kelos insisted. She tried to think of a way to prove it.

"I told you your prank wouldn't work, Celina" Arthras said feigning annoyance when in truth the transformed king found this situation hilarious. "Adults don't just turn into children!"

"AH! Your ring!" Kelos exclaimed, as she noticed a familiar looking piece of jewelry on Fia's finger. "I sent that to you for your birthday! It has an inscription on the inside of it."

"Well Prince Kelos did send me this ring, and it does have an inscription," Fia replied, a bit unsure. This girl's story was fantastical, and that was the sort of thing that could be guessed, but it would be a very lucky one.

"It says, 'kingdoms may war, but love overcomes all!'" Kelos stated confidently.

"That's right," Fia said. "How could you know that? I haven't told anyone."

"Because I had it made for you," Kelos said. "I'm Kelos, and that's really your father!"

"NO!" Arthras shouted. "That's Celina and I'm...umm... Ar..a... Arabella! That's it!"

"Father?" Fia asked. "Why would you do such a thing?"

"I did it for you," Arthras said. "Well mostly for you. If I changed myself into a young girl, I could start a new life and leave you the throne. And by transforming Kelos, you'd be free to marry whomever you wanted. And I'd have another shot at life."

"And leave me forever wondering what happened to you and Kelos?" Fia asked, visibly angry. "Fine then, Arabella. You want a new life? I'm sure I can find a good finishing school to teach my half sister to be a fine woman, despite being illegitimate."

"Fia, sweetie," Arthras gulped. "I know I wasn't being considerate of your feelings but..."

"Is that anyway for a child to talk to her sister and queen?" Fia asked sternly.

"Yes, that's no way for a little girl to talk," Kelos said smugly.

"Would you like to join your friend at finishing school, Celina?" Fia asked.

"No, your majesty," Kelos quickly replied with a clumsy curtsy.

"Then be a good girl and stay quiet." Fia scolded. Kelos did not respond.

"Do you at least have an antidote, Arabella?" Fia asked.
115131.title: Kelos speaks first and tells Fia who they are.

choices: Marlin is perplexed as to why a reversal potion didn't work.
Marlin says it's a quick fix!... Barring any complications.
Arabella opts to cause trouble./Something else.
1151311.content:
Arthras, or rather, currently, 'Arabella,' knew she only had one chance to dig herself out of the hole she'd hastily burrowed herself into. And that chance involved rushing over to the other side of the room, barely managing to avoid tripping over her skirt, and quickly, very quickly, plucking out an emerald green potion that was lying next to a bundle of travel supplies meant for the expedition she was planning to take earlier.

“Unfortunately, my dears!” The boisterous, deeply arrogant manner with which she spoke, came off entirely too comical with her young, girlish lilt. “I believe the proper order of things will soon be restored... Minus one troublesome former fiance!” And in a theatrical swoop, Arabella pulled the cork out from the vial, and glugged down its contents. She vaguely noted it tasted of sour apples.

“Father, no!” “You stupid idiot!” Fia and Kelos gasped in simultaneous shock: the former reaching her hand out- but it was too late! The only thing they could do was watch in horror, waiting for the powerful visage of the king to return!

...Waiting for the powerful visage of the king to return.

Still waiting...

Arabella stayed frozen in the pose she made while drinking, until after a long moment of nothing, her foot stamped down in frustration. “Why isn't it working?!” She barked: fists clenching, and a furrowed frustration marring her youthful features. “Marlin made it himself!”

Like a teakettle set to boil, Kelos, or, as her new sister attempted to dub her, 'Celina,' began to fume redder, and redder, and redder. “You... moron!” Without hesitation, she leaped over to the other side of the quarters, and began what couldn't be considered anything more favorable than a playground brawl: pulling at the blonde little girl's hair, smooshing her cheeks together... It was a pure emotional lashing out that lacked any of the maturity of finesse she as a prince held mere minutes ago. “Leave it to your dumb wizard guy to screw things up even worse!”

Biting commentary as this was, the squabble lasted barely a moment before an exacerbated Fia pulled them apart by the collar of their dresses. “I believe that's enough out of both of you.” This was punctuated by Arabella sticking her tongue out, while 'Celina' gave the most menacing growl her high-pitched soprano could muster. “It seems this situation might be a tad more complicated than any of us could expect. Now what I need you two to do is behave so we can all have a nice trip to Marlin's lab, and get some answers for how to fix things, okay?”

The children hunched their heads downward, and gave a defeated “Yes'm,” in response, which in turn beamed a smile onto the technically newly anointed queen.
1151311.title: Arthras tells Fia about the antidote

choices: Arthras agrees to drink the potion
Arabella refuses to drink the potion.
11513112.content:
"I see, I see," Marlin said as Fia recounted the events. "I hadn't considered that possibility, but of course it makes sense. Yes, it certainly does. Fascinating, fascinating!" The old wizard looked practically giddy.

"Am I to understand you know what the issue is, good sir wizard?" Fia asked.

"He better be able to change me back," Kelos said with a pout. Arthras simply sat in a corner twirling her now long hair with her finger.

"Indeed, it's simple, yes, quite simple indeed, but even a great wizard like myself would never predict it," Marlin said. "You see, both the king and prince drank the potion at the same time. One potion, split into two doses. But only King Arthras drank the reversal potion. But since the transformations were linked, the magic wasn't undone, since half the spell remained."

"I see, quite an oversight," Fia said.

"So we both need to drink the reversal potion at the same time?" Kelos asked.

"Quite right, young lady," Marlin replied, causing the transformed prince to frown. "I'll have a new potion brewed up in just a few minutes." The old wizard turned to his workbench and began to brew.

"I don't know, I kind of like being a child again," Arthras said with a smirk. "I was already getting old, but now I'm young once more. I think I'd rather stay like this. Plus, it has the added bonus of keeping Princess Celina around and unable to marry my daughter."

"You wouldn't!" Kelos exclaimed.

"I certainly would!" Arthras said. "In fact, please, call me Arabella from now on. "Oh, but since you're such a good friend of mine, Celina, you can call me Bella."

"Father, stop this foolishness at once," Fia commanded.

"Father? Are we playing pretend? Is Celina the mommy?" Arabella asked, playing the part of a young girl.

"You, you... big meanie!!!" Kelos shouted before bursting into tears. Fia instinctively moved to comfort her. Kelos wrapped her arms around Fia's waist and buried her head against Fia. "I don't wanna be a little girl for the rest of my life!"

"You should expect things like that," Marlin said as he mixed chemicals. "While they have the memories and personalities of their old selves, their brains are the same age as the rest of their body, so at times they may act as their old selves, while at others they may act like actual children would, particularly when upset."

"Don't worry, Celina," Arabella said cheerfully. "You'll grow up into a woman someday!"

"Done!" Marlin exclaimed, holding up two vials of the same greenish potion Arthras drank earlier. He walked over and gave one to the still sobbing Kelos. He then headed over to Arthras.

"I don't want it," Arabella said. "I'm serious, I'm staying like this."

"Now, now, if you wish, I can change you right back," Marlin said.

"Father, if you don't drink it, I'll enroll you as Arabella in a finishing school," Fia threatened.

"Oh, that's a good idea!," Arabella said. "Can Celina come too?"

"If there's anything left of the kind man who raised me in you, you can see how your actions are affecting poor Kelos here," Fia said. "Please, just drink the potion so things can return to normal and we can all put this traumatic and embarrassing situation behind us."
11513112.title: Marlin says it's a quick fix!... Barring an...

choices: Dealing with 'Arabella' and 'Celina' for the long-term.
Marlin's research into the problem.
Concerns from Grovan/Something else.
115131121.content:
Seeing the pleading, hopeful look of Fia staring down at her, Arabella's smug veneer slowly began to crack: giving way to that unfortunately icky feeling of 'guilt.' Features scrunched, and lips pursed, with the silence growing deafening, until...

“Ugh, fiiiiine.” Her voice childishly whined: arms crossing with her tongue lolled, as if she wanted to hurl at the very thought of giving in. She almost added the quick caveat that she'd do it on the condition Kelos drank it by joining her in a fun tea party, but she figured, all things considered, she was on thin enough ice as is.

Hearing this, the sniffling former prince beside her turned towards Arabella with a rising glimmer, though still tightly clutching to Fia's gown, like a deeply needed security blanket.

Snatching the potion from Marlin in a quick swipe, the blonde youth sighed. “Yes, yes. No need to cry Celina, your good friend Bella is going to fix everything.” The haughty tone she took had a cute immaturity to it, so much so that the previously whimpering 'Celina' let out a soft giggle. A smile. A nice smile, that Bella tilted her nose up at to save face, and not show her blush. “That is so long as you drink the antidote! If you clinging to Fia like this is any sign of what's to come with your future 'relationship,' I might just change my mind!”

The raven-haired little girl's face flared up like a cherry at hearing this, and realizing what she was doing, hurriedly let go. “Um, s- sorry...” Kelos stuttered, glancing three ways between Fia, Bella, and the vial she was still holding onto.

Fia's consternation thankfully began to deflate upon hearing Arabella's capitulation. “I... appreciate it, Father. You're acting very 'adult' right now.” She couldn't help but add that jab. This was certainly better than the alternative of taking her parent over her knee and disciplining her until she came to her senses.

“Like I said!” Marlin swiftly interjected: finger raised. “I can turn you right back, if this is your preferred appearance, my King!”

“Oh let's just get this over with!” Arabella huffed: popping the cap off the drink and glugging it down, just like before. Celina actually gasped in response: not quite so prepared, and did her best to fumble open the concoction, and sip it equally as fast.

And then they played the waiting game.

The waiting game.

Waiting...

Waiting, and waiting, until very clearly there was something not right going on.

“Oh my. How strange.” Marlin pondered, hand going to his chin. “Perhaps there's more here than meets the eye!”

“You mean it's not going to work?” Kelos asked in a wavy, right of the edge of tears, tone.

“You mean it's not going to work!” In contrast Arabella was much more excited. Elated even.

That earned the former ruler a scornful glare from her daughter, as she placed a comforting, maternal hand on Kelos' shoulder. “What seems to be the problem?” She asked the wizard, trying to keep a level head.

“Your highness, I am truly not sure.” The magician was eyeing the empty antidote containers with intense curiosity. “It seems my original hypothesis wasn't entirely correct, however. I do apologize!” He then swiftly turned to begin analyzing matters at his table. “This may take some time to sort out, but my oh my, I do love a challenge!” He seemed almost as giddy as Arabella.

Kelos, though, was far from pleased, as the reality of the situation settled in. A chill swept up through her, as she hugged herself in growing hear. “I... I can't stay like this... What about my parents?... My big sister?...” The color in her eyes began to fade, as she imagined how ashamed they'd naturally be. How much of an embarrassment she'd make her royal family look. Whether or not this was truthful, or an innately childish fear, it didn't matter. What mattered right now was that Celina was scared.

“Shh, shh.” Fia whispered a soothing hush, as the hand on the young girl's should doubled into a full, comforting hug. A hug that was very much needed at the moment. “We're not going to let anything bad happen to you, okay?” The princess (or potentially queen?) spoke in very precise, very deliberate words. “As of this moment, you are under the full, uncompromising protection of the sovereign kingdom of Traeven, and anyone who'd dare attempt to harm you would have to face the full might of her armies.” A pause, as she reached up to boop the child's nose. “And worse, if they get through them, they'll have to face me!”

This would've been a tender moment, had Arabella not chimed in. “It won't be so bad, Celina! We both get to be really pretty princesses together!” She punctuated this by giving a happy, playful twirl of her dress.

“Finishing School. I'm serious.” Fia countered in a deadpan growl.

Bella just offered an animated gasp. “We both get to be really pretty princesses together in Finishing School!”
115131121.title: Arthras agrees to drink the potion

choices: Arabella and Fia try to comfort Celina
Celina runs out of the room crying.
1151311213.content:
"Come on, Cel, it's already 7! Wake up sleepyhead!" Arabella, as the transformed king insisted on being called, shook the former Kelos awake.

"I'm awake, I'm awake," Celina replied as she sat up and stretched. "Are you going to do this every morning?"

"Every morning you oversleep, silly!" Arabella cheerfully replied. "Hurry up and get dressed! We're already late for breakfast!"

"Oookaaay," Celina yawned. She got out of bed, stripped off her nightgown, and walked over to a pile of Fia's old dresses. She picked out one, unbuttoned the back, and stepped into it, pulling it up and slipping her arms into the sleeves. "A little help... Bella."

"Sure!" Arabella buttoned the back of Celina's dress while humming happily.

"I still don't see how you can be so happy about this," Celina said as she put on a pair of shoes. "You were king!"

"I was an old man," Arabella replied. "All I had to look forward to was growing senile and frail." She spun around with her arms outstretched. "Now I'm a young girl with a full life ahead of me! Of course I'm happy about this!"

"I still want to find a way to change back," Celina said as she headed towards the door.

"I'm sure you'll come to enjoy being a girl too," Arabella replied, following behind.

"So breakfast," Celina said, changing the subject.

"Oh right!" Arabella pushed ahead of Celina. "We're gonna have pancakes with honey! Wanna race?" She dashed off ahead. Celina, having all of Kelos' competitiveness dashed after her.

"I win!" Arabella proclaimed as she arrived ahead of Celina by a split second.

"Nuh uh! You had a head start, and I still caught up," Celina replied.

"Your breakfast is cold, so neither of you won," Fia said sternly, sitting in the royal dinning room with three plates of pancakes.

"It was Cel's fault, she overslept!" Arabella said.

"Sorry, this body is just so sleepy in the morning," Celina replied sheepishly.

"Well with luck, Marlin will have this figured out soon, and you wont' have to worry about that," Fia said. "For now though I have some news, you have a letter from Grovan." She handed it over to Celina.

"Hopefully Mother and father have Xarlot working on a cure too," Celina said as she opened the letter and began reading with a smile. That quickly turned to a look of horror, as the color drained from her face and the letter fell to the floor. Arabella picked it up and began to read aloud.

                             Dear Kelos,
I'm writing this quickly hoping it will arrive before the official response from mother and father. Father is very angry about this, and blames you. He has decreed Prince Kelos is dead and forbids you from changing back. He initially wanted to banish you from Grovan as well, but mother and I have convinced him that is unreasonably harsh. As of now, you are welcome to return home and be welcomed as his youngest daughter. I insisted I be the one to bring you home. Can you imagine, father was going to leave that task to a mere servant. I shall see you soon.

Your loving older sister,                    
Orianna
1151311213.title: Concerns from Grovan/Something else.

choices: Days on, Bella tries to be the 'best big sister in the world,' and cheer up Cel.
Orianna arrives, and is flustered by how cute Cally- Celina is.
Fia suspects Ori has ulterior motives/Something else.
11513112131.content:
“WHAT A LOAD OF BALONEY THIS IS!” Arabella was not subtle in her exclamation of distaste: tossing her arms up in the air, and pacing around in a stomping circle. “I NEVER DID LIKE THAT KING! HE GETS A CUTE NEW LITTLE GIRL INSTEAD OF A BORING OLD PRINCE, AND THAT'S SOMEHOW BAD?!” Spinning on her heels, she pointed a finger directly at her daughter. “FIA! I ORDER YOU TO GO TO WAR! THIS INSTANT!”

Fia however was paying less attention to the mountain of hot air that was her father, and more at the heartbreaking ocean of despair on her former fiance's face. “Celina?...” She asked, hesitantly inching forward: unsure how to console.

For Celina, it started with a sniffle. Then some welling at the edge of her face. The part of her that was Kelos urged her to keep strong. That blithering emotions like these were useless, and what her father was condemning. But the very thought of her father brought the Celina part of herself out in full fold, and Celina was very, very sad.

She bawled. She bawled her eyes out. Sitting in front of the plate of big floofy pancakes, it painted an almost macabre picture, but she couldn't help it. “M- M- MY DADDY HAAAAATES MEEEEE!” The way she said 'Daddy.' The pure emotional cry. Doing any of this would've absolutely humiliated Kelos, but Celina was past humiliation.

That was all Fia needed to swoop in. She lifted Celina into her arms, and clutched at her like a wounded animal. Whatever relationship they might've had when Kelos was a grown man was washed away clean at that moment, and became replaced with a maternal care and need to support this child. “Shh, shh,” and other comforts cooed from the queen's lips, telling Celina that someone was there for her, and that she was loved.

Arabella, meanwhile, seeing the closest thing she currently had to a sister so broken, felt her bluster deflate. “I- it'll be alright, Celina.” She stuttered in assurance. “I- it's like Fia said at the start! You're under the protection of Traeven! And unlike stinky Grovan, we know princesses are the best! And since you're a princess now, you're the best!”

Unfortunately, there wasn't much anyone could say at this time which would improve the situation. In reality, Celina simply needed a good cry. Her only hope at this time would be if Orianna could somehow come through as the best big sister in the world, and fix things.
11513112131.title: Arabella and Fia try to comfort Celina

choices: Ori convinced their parents to allow Kelos to return to normal.
Celina is here to stay permanently.
115131121312.content:
"Celina wake up! Breakfast is ready!" Arabella rocked the former prince turned young princess back and forth. Rather than stirring, Celina just pulled the blankets tighter.

"I'm not hungry."

"Don't say that, you've barely eaten in the past three days!" Arabella exclaimed as she continued to try to stir the girl. "You need to eat so you'll grow up to be a beautiful princess!"

"Just leave me alone," Celina replied.

"Nope! Fia told me to get you to come down to breakfast today no matter what!" Arabella responded cheerfully. "The royal chef even made your favorite~"

Celina peaked out from the cocoon of blankets she had wrapped herself with. "How do you know what my favorite is?"

"I may have heard it from a certain princess who stopped by for a visit," Arabella said with a sing song voice.

"Ori's here?" Celina asked.

"Yup, and we're going to show her just how cute her new little sister is!"

Celina replied by burying herself completely under the covers again.

Arabella sighed. "I've been going easy on you, but if it's going to be like that..." She snapped her fingers and a maid came into the room, holding a box. "I'm going to use my secret weapon!" She opened the box and pulled out a large chunk of ice, fresh from a glacier in the mountains to the south east. "One last chance..." She waited for a reply that was not forthcoming. "Sorry, but you leave me no choice." She plunged the ice under Celina's blanket.

A second passed with no reaction. Then several seconds. Then finally Celina burst out from under her blankets. "It's so cold!"

"Gotcha!" Arabella said. She gestured to the maid, who quickly removed the blankets from Celina's bed. "Now let's get you ready~"

Celina slumped her shoulders, admitting defeat. Before long she was ready for breakfast, wearing a violet dress, with her hair up in pig tails. Arabella practically dragged her through the halls of the castle, until they reached the royal dining chamber.

"I brought her!" Arabella called out as the two young girls entered the room.

"Oh my, Cally! You're soooo cuute!" Orianna exclaimed as she saw her former brother's new appearance. She leapt up from her seat. "You look just like you did back when we were little! When I get you home I'll have so much for you to try on! It'll be Cally time all the time! That dress is so cute, and your hair, it's just incredible!" She knelt down and hugged Celina.

"Cally?" Arabella asked.

"That's Kelos' name when he would wear dresses," Orianna said.

"You dressed me up like that!" Celina exclaimed. "Mother and father stopped it when I was eight!" She tried to pull away from her older sister, but was unable to.

"And now you're eight again and a real girl," Orianna said. "Mother and father won't stop you from wearing all the cute dresses you want this time, Cally."

"Celina," she corrected. "As long as I'm a girl I'm going to be Celina."

"Not as cute as Cally, but still a cute name," Orianna replied. "My sweet little sister Celina."

"Princess Orianna," Fia interrupted. "Perhaps now would be the time to reveal the official response from Grovan to this development?"

"Of course, Queen Fia," Orianna said. She let go of Celina, and walked back to the table, sat down, and picked up a scroll.
115131121312.title: Orianna arrives, and is flustered by how cute C...

1151311213121.content:
Orianna put on her gruffest 'Father' voice, as she began to read aloud. “'Dear' 'Prince' 'Kelos.'” A pause, as she turned her head, “Well, I don't think that many single-line quotation marks was necessary.” before continuing. “I have debated long and hard regarding your stupendous blunder on your mission in Traeven. At first, I had wholeheartedly decided to banish you! No ifs, ands, or buts. But thanks to the efforts of your older sister and mother, I have cooled on the notion. For now.”

Celina gulped as she heard this, though it wasn't anything new. Ori's original letter said as much, but it looked like her sibling was continuing on.

“Instead, I present three choices to you. Nothing more, nothing less. The first is simple: You are banished. Maybe you'll end up on the streets. Maybe Traeven will take you in. Either way, you will be stripped of any title to this family, but at the same time, will not have to face the humiliation of returning to Grovan in your current... 'state.'”

The young royal clenched her fists. She had been bracing herself for this. Bracing herself as much as possible. But it still hurt. Hurt enough to cause a small sniffle of a cry.

“I present you though a second option. If you can stand the embarrassment of your actions, you may take your place back in this family. But in the only place left suitable: our young daughter. You will be raised as such. You will be treated as such. Anything and everything that was 'Prince' Kelos will be wiped forever from our historical records.”

“Goodness...” Fia couldn't help but let out a small exhale of shock at just how brutal Celina's father was being. Her thoughts easily began to wander in contemplative ways.

“But at last, I give you the ultimate means of salvation: a way to return back.” This caused the entire room's attention to be fully drawn in. “Our wizard Xarlat has been making good progress on a reversal spell. Apparently, anyway. And I would be willing to offer it to you, only if you face the challenge I am presenting: prove to me you aren't the weak little girl I envision you to be. When you return to Grovan, for 30 days, I expect you to undergo every challenge, every predicament, every hurdle Prince Kelos would face as a grown man. From diplomatic meetings, to daily warrior training. There won't be a single stone left unturned.”

“WHAT?!” Arabella bellowed in absolute shock. “THAT'S RIDICULOUS! RIDICULOUS! HE CAN'T MAKE CELINA DO THAT!” Already the blonde was stomping around, back and forth. “I SHOULD'VE WENT TO WAR WITH HIM YEARS AGO! THAT IS NOT HOW YOU TREAT CUTE LITTLE GIRLS LIKE US!”

“If you choose this option however, be warned; it comes at a risk. Being unable to uphold your identity as a prince will be your second failing, and a failing of this caliber will not stand. You will be banished. Totally, and utterly. That is my ultimatum.” Ori promptly broke her 'Father' tone and wrapped things up. “After that, it just says 'Signed King Reginald.'” Her hands were already beginning to roll up the scroll.

“For once I think I might agree with my Father...” Queen Fia's eyes were far away as she mumbled this. “This must be a lot to take in.” She noted, turning to Celina.

“I'm sure, but I think the proper direction is obvious.” Orianna curtly said: standing up. “Father's last proposal is an utter farce. I don't believe it's within a fragment of reason to even consider it. We shouldn't encourage him. I'm sure he'll cool, and not be such a grouch once he sees how tremendously cute Celina is!”

“CELINA SHOULDN'T EVEN BE AROUND THAT OLD WINDBAG! FIA! FIA! TELL THAT GROVAN GIRL THAT CELINA IS STAYING WITH US! SHE'S A TRAEVEN PRINCESS NOW!” Arabella face was as red as a tomato: her old rival Reginald's words dancing around her head. This was unacceptable!

The funny thing was, Fia was quickly beginning to believe that might not be the worst option. “If Celina wants to stay here, she very much can. We put her into this mess, and it's the least we can do.”

All eyes pointed to the little girl, as she made her decision.
1151311213121.title: Ori convinced their parents to allow Kelos to r...

choices: Arabella grabs the potion and drinks it herself.
Celina asks if she can drink it after all.
11513112131212.content:
"I can't do the same physical training as an adult like this," Kelos said sadly. "But maybe if I talk with father he'll understand. I'll go back as Celina."

"No, you should stay here and be a princess of Traeven!" Arabella insisted.

"Excellent!" Orianna exclaimed, clapping her hands together. "I knew you'd make the right choice. After all, you did so love Cally time when you were little. Little the first time that is."

"Ori!" Celian replied, blushing slightly.

"Don't forget you're welcome to come back anytime," Fia offered.

"Yes, come back and visit," Arabella added. "We can have a slumber party!"

"I'll consider it," Celina said.

"Well I'm just glad you saw reason and I didn't have to use this nasty thing," Orianna said with a relieved sigh. She pulled a bottle containing a clear liquid out from between her breasts.

Everyone in the room looked at the bottle in Orianna's hand in silence. It was Fia who broke it and asked the question on all their minds. "Princess Orianna, just what is that?"

"It's a memory erasing potion. Whoever drinks it will lose all memory of who they are," She explained. "Vile and in quite poor taste, but Father just insisted I bring it in case Celina wasn't cooperative."

"You were going to make me drink that?" Celina asked in shock.

"Perish the thought!" Orianna said. "I never expected to need it. Now that I've proven I was right and Father wrong, it can be disposed of." She turned to Fia. "I trust your wizard is capable in that task."

"Yes, he should be," Fia said. She stepped forward to talk the potion from Orianna, who gave it up.

"This potion erases all of a person's memory?" Arabella asked.

"Not all of it," the Grovan princess replied. "Merely memory of who they are. The person will retain other memories, so they won't forget how to speak or walk or anything like that."

"So let's say Celina did drink it, she'd forget about being Kelos completely?"

"Yes, she'd just know she's a well educated girl with no memory of who she was," Orianna explained. "Though in a situation like this, it almost seems like it would be killing Kelos."

Celina looked at her sister, completely shocked at the revelation."F-Father was going to do that to me?"

"He didn't want to, but as twisted as it seems, he thought it was doing you a favor." Orianna said. "It would give you a completely new start and you'd be happier."

"I can see some logic to that," Arabella said. "I mean you've been pretty sad because of this." She looked at the bottle in Fia's hand. "A fresh start does have a certain appeal to it..."
11513112131212.title: She follows Ori's lead, and returns as '...

Ori and Celina talk on the carriage ride over.

115131121312121.content:
“No.” Fia sniped, as she watched Bella try to sneakily grab the potion from her. The little girl thankfully failed. “I've been burdened with enough new obligations because of this flight of fancy of yours, Father. I'm not going to lose you because you want the real 'little girl' experience.” The new queen tutted at the blonde.

“Fooey.” the regressed figure pouted. “I'm sure Marlin could make an antidote! It'd just be fun for a little while!”

The two children stood awkwardly between each other: silence ringing in the moment, as they settled that this would probably be the last time they'd see each other for a while.

“So, um...” Arabella began. “Sorry about everything. And stuff.” She said this, while crossing her arms, and turning her head away.

There was a lotCelina could say here. This girl stripped her of her manhood. Her title as a prince. And turned anything and everything upside down! But only one thought coursing through her managed to escape her lips. “You really like being a princess, don't you?”

That perked Bella's face right up. “And I'm sure you will too, if you just embrace it! If that meanie king of yours tries to ruin all the fun you could be having, then just come live here with us! You can be a princess of Traeven! We'll be sisters!”

For some reason, Celina couldn't help but blush at that. There was something just real earnest and friendly about the offer, despite all that had happened.

Before she could respond, Ori was right behind her, with a hand on her shoulder. “We should probably get going now, Little Celina! Father grumbled about sending troops if there's trouble, and if we 'took too long.'” She finished that statement with a sigh.

“SEND THOSE TROOPS! THAT OLD WIND BAG SHOULD KNOW TRAEVEN'S THE TOUGHEST KINGDOM IN THE LAND!” It was rather impressive how on a dime Arabella could switch from snooty, to utterly ready for a brawl.

Fia though had already plucked her up by the nape of her dress, as the youth's arms and legs went flailing. “Princess Orianna, you and Celina are free to visit here whenever you like. I'm sure my father would appreciate the extra company.”

A twinkle couldn't help but appear in Orianna's eye. “Oh, you and I should definitely stay in touch, Queen Fia! We have two rambunctious girls we'll be taking care of, and I'm sure we can exchange notes and tips. Plus, maybe have tea together!”

Some of the specifics of what next was being said began to filter out of Celina's mind. Configured into 'grownup stuff.' Right now, she was ruminating on what the future held, when it came to returning to Grovan...

"The castle looks bigger than I remember," Celina said, fidgeting in her seat as she looked out the window at the distant structure.

"You weren't as small and cute the last time you were home," Orianna said.

"If you say so," Celina replied, still unconvinced.

The carriage continued towards Castle Grovan, now having left the road and entered the city surrounding the walls. Celina peeked out, but upon seeing the people lining the road quickly ducked down into Orianna's lap. The former adult prince turned 8 year old princess was trembling with nervousness. With that statement, Celina suddenly sprang up. She then cautiously looked out the window then just as suddenly ducked back down. "They're really there."

"Yup, so how about we get out of the carriage and greet our parents like proper daughters?"

"Okay."

As if on cue, the driver hopped down from the front and opened the door. Orianna got out first, and then turned, took Celina's hand and helped her out of the carriage. The two princesses then faced their parents.

"Mother, father, I have returned, and I'd like you to meet your youngest daughter, Celina."

Celina stood there nervously, for a few moments before managing to get out a shaky "I'm home."

It also seemed to be made of a tougher material that looked like it could stand up to the elements. Arthras spoke, "I remember that Fia wore this dress the one and only time I tried to take her hunting. She absolutely hated it, wouldn't stop crying. She scared off all of the wildlife for miles around. It was a good day with her." Arthras said nostalgically as he began to put it on.

Kelos didn't put in any thought in his choice of outfit, he too took dress since that seemed to be all there was. He just went with a simple blue dress because it was probably one of the least feminine dresses Kelos could find. After they got dressed the pair of princesses were taken to breakfast where they had a miniature feast of all the pancakes they could eat. Although Kelos only got through about half of his second plate because Arthras began to chastise 'her' for ruining her figure. After breakfast Princess Fia entered the room and greeted her little 'sisters'.

"I'm glad to see you two up and about already Ariella and Kellia. Because our guests have arrived early. So let's put on our best faces. Kellia, it looks like you've got a pit of syrup on your chin." Kelos blushed and Fia bent down, licked her thumb, and rubbed the mess off of Kelos' face. "Thank you." Kelos said meekly. "Anything for you." Fia said radiating charm. If she was worried about the whereabouts of her father, she was not letting it show. Although Arthras did notice Fia's eyes were a bit red, perhaps from crying.

As soon as Fia stood up the doors to great hall opened and the guests entered. There were 7 guests. Two adults who were here for the negotiation and 5 children. They were all obviously forign because of their clothing. They must come from one of the desert nations to the south Kelos figured because even though it was only mildly chilly outside, they were all dressed as though it were a blizzard. The man who was dressed the finest stepped forward, "I am Walch, diplomat of Nubario, these are my children," Walch clapped his hands and the three most well dressed children stepped forward.

The youngest boy who seemed about 7 bowed, "Sebastian." Next was the middle child of about 11, the girl who curtsied and said in a voice that said she didn't want to be there, "Tae." And the oldest boy who was maybe 12 stepped right up to Arthras and Kelos and extended his hand palm up as though waiting for something, "And I am Richard. Charmed I'm sure." Kelos looked at the boy unsure of what he was doing but Arthras didn't miss a beat, "And I am Princess Ariella." And much to Kelos' surprise Arthras put his hand in Richard's and let Richard kiss it." Kelos still could not believe how fully Arthras seemed to have embraced this role he had chosen for himself. Kelos looked back to Richard to see that once again he had extended his hand before him now. If Fia was not watching Kelos would slug the brat right there on the spot, but he still had to win Fia's love and affection and punching a diplomat's child would certainly hinder that, so he reluctantly gave the boy his hand and let it be kissed. "Kellia." Kelos said bluntly. Kelos looked back to Fia who smiled and nodded subtly towards him.

Next the other adult stepped forward, she was dressed nice, but not as nicely as the diplomat, "And I am Sir Walch's associate, Shanoa and these are my girls. Lora and Korra." Two twin girls about age 9 stepped forward and curtsied.

After the introductions ended Walch looked at Arthras and Kelos, "I was under the impression that you were the only child of King Arthras, where is he by the way, I was told he was not here?"

Arthras and Kelos looked at Fia, both curious as to what Fia would say, "My father is negotiating a very important treaty with Grovan at the moment and it's unfortunately taken much longer than initially estimated. He sends his apologies for missing this meeting but I assure you that I am more than capable to negotiating with you as I have studied under my father my whole life. As for my little sisters," Fia gave them a loving smile, "My father did not wish to make their existence known. You know how some nations are, the oldest child is the heir and the younger children are pawns. My father did not want that life for them and kept their existence unknown until they were ready to face society. He wanted them to just be little girls for as long as he could."

Arthras was stunned at these words, he had expected and wouldn't have blamed Fia if she had thrown him under the bus, but even if she was furious with him, she still stood up for him. Arthras was beaming with pride in his daughter.

Watch seemed satisfied with this answer so he and Shanoa left with Fia leaving Arthras and Kelos with the children. Kelos felt the eyes of all the children shifting over to him and looking him up and down, specifically the slightly sleazy Richard. An awkward silence hung in the air for a minute before Arthras took charge. "Well you must be tired from your long journey, how about I escort you all to the castle grounds and relax under the trees. One of the twins, Korra Kelos thought, yawned and without speaking walked up to Arthras. "And while we sit we can watch the Royal heard of horses graze on the planes. The other twin Lora squeezed and joined her sister beside Arthras. Tae seemed to think she was too old and cool to simply be bought off at the idea of watching horses so Arthras added, "Tae, since you're older I'm sure we can talk to a stable hand to see if you can ride one." Tae tried to hide her smile but failed as she joined Arthras. Arthras looked at the little boy Sebastian and smiled, "And it's not just horses, you can see the soldiers practicing their fighting moves, does't that sound neat." Sebastian obviously thought it did as he too joined the Arthras' little gang.

Arthras looked at Kelos and smiled, "I think I can handle this lot, think you can handle Richard on your own?"

"Of course I can, after all I am Princ...ess...Kelia. Of Traeven." Kelos said a bit sadly.

"Right you are, okay guys, lets go have fun." With that Arthras and his group left for the grounds leaving Kelos with Richard.

Richard got awkwardly close to Kelos and said, "The outdoors is nice and all but there are much more interesting things in here aren't their. We both seem to be the most mature of our group, I say we should join our elders at the meeting. After all we deserve to be there. Kelos thought to himself, 'Well I most certainly do, but you are still a child, I should try to keep him away from the meeting if I want to stay on Fia's good side.'

"No, I don't think we should, but there are other places in the castle worth exploring like..." Kelos couldn't think of anything, after all he wasn't entirely familiar with the interior of Castle Traeven yet. Richard got a glint in his eye, "Doesn't your castle have a magician? You should take me to him, I'd love to see real magic."

That actually wasn't a terrible idea, if Kelos could find Marlin he could probably order him to show the boy some simple tricks to satisfy his curiosity...then again with magic things do not always go as intended.
1151321112221.title: Waking up and Dealing with the Guests

choices: Marlin says he was about to take a break.
Marlin needs some subjects for an experiment.
11513211122212.content:
"I guess visiting Marlin would be okay," Kelos replied. "But I'm sure he's busy with research, so we can't stay long."

"That's fine, I just want to see some actual magic," Richard said. "It will take but a few minutes of his time. Please, lead the way, m'lady." He motioned for Kelos to walk ahead.

Kelos began to walk when it dawned on her, she had never actually been to Marlin's lab, and had no idea where it was. Xarlot's lab was deep within the bowels of Castle Grovan, beneath even the dungeon, where he would often get subjects for his experiments. But Marlin? His lab could be anywhere. She stopped. "I just realized, I've never actually been to Marlin's lab."

"Not even once?" Richard asked skeptically. "Weren't you curious?"

"My sister and I weren't raised in the castle, and I didn't visit as often as she did," Kelos said. "I'll ask someone." She led Richard through the halls, until she found a maid.

"Oh, good morning Princess Arialla," the maid said, seeing her.

"Kellia," Kelos corrected. "And good morning."

"I'm terribly sorry Princess Kellia!" the maid exclaimed. "Kellia has the dark hair, Arialla the blonde, Kellia has dark hair, Arialla the blonde," she repeated a few times to herself.

"I need some directions," Kelos said, interrupting the maid. "Richard here is the son of the diplomat from Nubario. He'd like to meet Marlin, but I don't know where his lab is."

"Of course, Princess" the maid replied. "It's right this way." She led Kelos and Richard through the maze like halls.

"Didn't we pass that bust before?" Richard asked as they continued on for what seemed to be a rather long time.

"K-king Arthras likes art so the castle has more than one like that," the maid said unconvincingly.

"You do know where Marlin's lab is, right?" Kelos asked.

"I do!" the maid insisted. "It's just that I'm not sure where we are now."

"Women," Richard said with a sigh.

"Last time we went left after that bust, so this time, let's go right," Kelos said. She led the group down the hall.

"This looks familiar," the maid said. "Marlin's lab should be this way." Before long the group arrived in front of an indistinct wooden door. "This is it!"

"Thank you," Kelos said.

"It was a pleasure Princess," the maid said with a curtsy.

With that the door opened and an old man with a long white beard stepped out. "Oh, it seems I have some visitors. And what good timing"
11513211122212.title: Kelos takes Richard to see Marlin

choices: It's a love potion, the first person the drinker kisses will love them
Don't threaten a wizard, the drinkers think of themselves as young girls
115132111222122.content:
"Ah yes, very good. I was hoping some willing subjects would come to volunteer for an experiment I'm about to perform." The old man said with a friendly smile looking down at the two children in front of him.

The son of the Nubarian diplomat went from cocky to squeamish in a matter of seconds, "Experiment? But but what are you going to do to us?" Richard said as he inched behind Kelos. Kelos scoffed at the boy, this was no way for a dignitary from a foreign land should act before his hosts. Kelos had that lesson drilled into him harshly as a young man by his instructors. Marlin saw the boy's fear and chuckled, "Well, normally when a child comes to my door it's because they want to see a little magic, and what a better way to see it than to experience it first hand. I've got a number of potions that need refining, all safe I assure you, I tested them all on the cleaning staff myself. Oh hello there Ivory, good to see you again. You aren't experiencing any side effects after being a goldfish last week are you?"

The maid who (kind of) escorted Richard and Kelos to Marlin looked surprised to be addressed, "Oh yes, I'm Ivory. Nope, no issues here, now I need go back to...clean...I think. Goodbye." Ivory turned to leave but a few seconds later accidentally entered the room again before finally successfully leaving. Marlin squinted with curiosity and said aloud, "Note to self, give Ivory an elephant potion to try and counter the memory loss from the goldfish potion." Richard gasped as he saw a quill begin to write down Marlin's notes on it's own.

Kelos looked at the old wizard with a look of disbelieving, "Can't you just simply enhance her memory?"

"Because I already know that would work, I don't know if my elephant solution will. You see kids, magic can not advance without testing it's limits. We can't just settle for the simple solution, we must explore and learn and better ourselves along the way young...I'm so sorry I didn't catch your names."

Richard nervously stepped forward, "I am Richard of Nubario, and this is as you well should know is Princess Kellia of Traeven."

"Oh?" Marlin said looking at Kelos confused before his eyes widened, "Oh," and then Marlin's jaw dropped a little as realization fully hit him, "Oh! Oh oh my yes. Of course I know you Princess Kellia. A fine Princess of this land who will grow to...you will certainly grow into something one day if you...well, you know."

Well if there was any doubt Kelos had, that just confirmed it. It seemed Arthras wasn't lying and Marlin already knew about this situation and was probably working on disguising those criminal corpses into 'Arthras' and 'Kelos' as ordered by the former King. But that meant that somewhere in this lab was some sort of magic that could turn Kelos back into himself.

"Well Marlin, I believe you know what I want. I want to experience some magic first hand, and you know what I'm talking about. If you give it to me now I won't be mad, in fact you will be rewarded beyond your dreams and my...sister will be the only one who will face my wrath. However if you do not...well I may be small now but I still know how to hurt a man even if he is a wizard." Kelos didn't even realize what he was doing. Even though he was a cute 10 year old girl in a dress he had backed Marlin up against a wall.

Marlin nervously twist his beard, "I can't give you...that. It's not ready at the moment, and if I give it to you," Kelos shot daggers at Marlin with his eyes, "When, I mean when I give it to you, it will be after you have...as my King, I mean your sister Ariella has given his approval which I'm certain he he, no SHE will. Yes."

Kelos didn't move and his face did not fully approve of this news, "But I do have a potion ready that you can take and it will make things much easier for you I'm sure and you'll be out and...having fun in no time." Marlin said frantically.

"I want to have fun." A voice called out, Marlin and Kelos looked at Richard who they had both forgotten was there. "Whatever potion you're going to give her, I want it to. I'm not afraid." The clearly afraid boy said his voice trying not to shake.

Kelos sighed, "Very well, if this indeed does help me, your kindness will not be forgotten wizard."

Marlin quickly went to a cauldron and quickly mixed something together and gave a small purple vial to both of the children. "Drink up and enjoy."

Richard downed it quickly and Kelos soon followed wondering how Marlin thought a potion would help him out in his effort to make Princess Fia love him.
115132111222122.title: Marlin needs some subjects for an experiment

choices: Richard kisses Ariella, Kelos' plan worked
Richard kisses Kellia putting them both under each other's love spell
1151321112221221.content:
After downing the very sweet tasting potion Kelos looked up to Marlin, "So how will this help me out of my situation." Marlin gave a friendly smile and said, "Well Princess Kellia, I just gave you and your little friend here your first love potions. But for now it is laying dormant inside of you. It will release into another through your lips when you make contact with them. A kiss is probably the most logical way for this to happen. So the first person that you kiss will instantly love you, and having someone love you is not only a nice feeling, it will also help you get what you want if you know how to do it."

Kelos nodded appreciatively, he would have preferred a potion that would just turn him from 'Princess Kellia' to his Prince Kelos true form, but this love potion could still help him. Arthras had said he's help Kelos turn back if Kelos could get the princess to truly love him even in this little girl form. And while Kelos had no doubt he could charm Princess Fia even with this body, he only had a limited amount of time before his fake dead body was to be found making it nearly impossible for him to return. Kelos smiled to himself thinking the when Fia tucked in her precious 'little sister' tonight he would give her a good night kiss and seal his fate to guarantee his return.

Kelos was a bit lost in his thoughts when he was returned to reality upon hearing a voice beside him say, "But what if I don't know who I want to kiss? I mean I have so many options." Kelos had almost forgotten the annoying boy Richard was still with him, and what's more had taken the love potion too.

Marlin laughed, "Well you should have thought about before you drank it shouldn't you."

"But I didn't know what I was drinking."

"Again, not my fault, now while this has been a fun distraction, I really must get back to work. Now you two go back to your parents or guardians or whatever." With that Marlin pushed the two youths from his lab. As the two made their way back to the other group of children Richard would not shut up about who he should make fall in love with him. He kept listing off every young female of status in his homeland of Nubario. Kelos could care less about the love life of a 12 year old annoying child when a delightfully wicked thought occurred to him. "What if you didn't wait to use your love potion kiss for when you go back home? I didn't want to embarrass her, but I think my sister Ariella has a crush on you and if you kissed her that would make her go crazy for you. And don't you like the idea of having a foreign princess pining over you?"

"Yeah, I guess that is a good idea." Richard said now lost in thought. Kelos laughed diabolically internally. This felt like the perfect payback for that Arthras for getting him stuck in this situation. If he wanted to be a little girl so back he could live like one, including being in love with and courting foreign dignitaries. As Kelos and Richard made entered the great hall they saw that Arthras and the others were already finished with their outdoor adventure. The youngest boy Sebastion was jumping up and down as he bounded to his older brother. "Richard, you should have been there! I saw the soldiers practicing their moves, and Ariella even made one of them let me touch their bow and arrow! It was so cool, and then..."

"Yes that's nice." Richard said brushing off his little brother. "Before you go on, there's something I want to do and I want everyone here to see me do it." Richard looked at the two young 'princesses' of Traeven. "Thank you both for opening up your palace to me and my family and friends. And I'd love to come back again and hopefully see you again to spend more time with you." With this the girls from Nubario gasped as Richard stepped forward and surprised one of the princesses with a love potion influenced kiss.
1151321112221221.title: It's a Love Potion that activates with a kiss

choices: Leave Richard and Kellia under the love potion influence
Arthras decided to save Kelos from the love magic
11513211122212212.content:
Kelos thought Richard was going to kiss Arthras. Kelos thought that when he did, Arthras would be out of his hair for good leading him to the easy track of turning back into his normal form and marrying Princess Fia. Kelos thought that, but he was wrong. And they were the last things Kelos thought of because the second Richard's lips touched his, Kelos' mind went blank and nothing else mattered except the cute 12 year old boy in front of him. Kelos felt ashamed that such a cute boy could care so much about him, but Kelos knew that it must be meant to be, because he was no longer Prince Kelos of Ostia. She was now Princess Kellia of Traeven and she was a little girl in love.

All her anger at Arthras turned into gratitude, because if Arthras hadn't tricked her into taking this form she would never have met the love of her life. Kellia was also so very grateful to Marlin who's love potion now assured that Richard felt just as head of heels in love as she did. The two cutely kissed in the middle of the room, their childish lips barely touching each other, after all Richard didn't really have much experience in the kissing department and Kellia wanted to be lady like and let Richard take the lead.

Arthras on the other hand was very amused by what was happening. As soon as Richard kissed his 'sister' Arthras burst out laughing and didn't stop laughing for a while. But when Arthras finally did stop he was surprised to see that Richard and Kellia were still kissing very happily. Sensing something was very wrong he asked, "Kellia, is everything all right?"

Kellia and Richard broke the kiss but didn't break eye contact, "Everything is more than all right Princess Ariella, I've found the love of my life in your sister."

"You've...what?" Arthras stuttered while the other children in the room all began to ooh and ah thinking it was just like a fairy tale. Arthras was not as enchanted with this love story, "What exactly happened while the rest of us were outside?"

Richard answered, "We went to see your court wizard and the rest of it doesn't matter, all that matters is that today I promise when we are of age, I will return to marry you Princess Kellia."

"That day can't come soon enough." Kellia smiled with a slightly vacant expression behind her eyes. Arthras knew what must have happened next, Richard and Kelos must have gotten put under a spell by Marlin somehow. He'd have to go see him soon to figure out the details so that he could fix it.

Or should he? A mischievous thought crossed Arthras' mind, what if he didn't fix Kelos and the boy. What if he just let whatever love spell they were under run it's course and leave Kelos as happy little Kellia forever. Sure it was a bit of an underhanded way for Arthras to keep Kelos from marrying Fia, but nobody was going to be hurt. In fact who knows, maybe Kellia would be happier this way than Kelos ever could be. As Arthras looked at Kellia and Richard, he knew what he wanted to do.
11513211122212212.title: The Plan goes wrong and Richard kisses Kellia

choices: Before the wedding, someone wants to have a special talk with 'Ariella'
The Wedding goes off without a Hitch
115132111222122121.content:
"Be honest Ariella, do you think he'll like it?" Kellia said with concern to her sister as they stood in their shared bedroom.

"Kellia, honestly, you could go out there in a potato sack and Richard would still love you. Just face it, you both love each other more than anything in the world. It's been that way for 8 years and it will be that way for 800 more I bet." Arthras said smiling at his sister of the last 8 years as she was going through last minute doubts of her dress choice mere hours before the wedding ceremony. As Arthras looked at the nervous teenage girl before him, it was hard to believe that 8 years ago this love sick girl was once the fierce and aggressive Prince Kelos, but thanks to the love potion from Marlin, Kellia left that life behind without a second thought and dedicated herself to making herself the perfect bride for her beloved Richard. Arthras occasionally felt a little guilty about what became of Kelos, but then he saw how happy Kellia was and what's more how happy his daughter Fia was.

For a mere week after Kellia and Richard fell in love, Arthras made the final arrangements with Marlin for 'King Arthras' and 'Prince Kelos' to be found, killed by bandits on the way to negations at his country estate. Fia had been heartbroken at the news of the death of her 'father' and the young man who she did have some feelings towards. But having two new little sisters and a nation to take care of helped Fia to quickly cope. She was a very capable ruler as Arthras knew she would, but she had become colder. But slowly that coldness thawed the more time she spent with her little sisters. Especially the younger more love sick one. Seeing how much Kellia was head over heels in love with Richard of Nubario seemed to bring a joy to her life that she wouldn't have otherwise had. Although Fia did find it odd that whenever she asked Kellia about her life before coming to Traeven, she seemed to honestly not remember anything before meeting Richard.

As they continued to grow into young women, Kellia continued to fall further in love, and 'Ariella' became a capable advisor to the now Queen Fia even at a young age. They grew along this path until the day arrived when Kellia came of age and Richard gave her the gift of a wedding ring. It is said Kellia's cries of joy were heard from even Grovan.
115132111222122121.title: Leave Richard and Kellia under the love potion ...

choices: Ariella agrees to help Orianna.
Ariella vows to stop Orianna from disrupting the wedding.
1151321112221221211.content:
"What's so important it couldn't wait until after the wedding?" Ariella asked her maid, as she was led to her study.

"The visitor didn't say, just that it was urgent," the maid replied.

"Who is it anyway?" Ariella asked as they reached the doors. The maid opened it, to reveal a 30 something woman with long, red, curly, hair, mired by a few streaks of grey who was fiddling with some items on Ariella's desk. The woman turned. "Ah Princess Ariella. We really need to talk."

Ariella entered the room, and gestured to the maid to leave. "My sister is getting married in a few hours, what's this about?"

"Your sister, huh?" the woman replied. "We both know that isn't true, don't we, Arthras?"

Ariella's jaw dropped. "T-That's crazy," she replied. "My father died years ago."

"I suppose that much is true," the woman said. "Unless he pulled the same trick you did. However, that was before I was even born. Perhaps it's time I introduce myself. I am Princess Orianna of Grovan, and I have come to end this charade and bring Kelos home. Though I don't particularly care if it's as a man or woman. I know exactly who you are, Ariella, and who Kellia is. This wedding is a sham, and it will stop. I don't care if you want to live the rest of your life as a woman, and honestly I'd rather have Kelos as my little sister than my little brother, but as her older sister, I shall not allow her to be brainwashed into marriage."

Ariella stood there speechless for moment. "How? No one knew except Marlin and I!"

"When Kelos was 12 I set a magical trap for him, which turned him into a girl," Orianna explained. "Do you remember when we met for the funeral for you and Kelos? I noticed then Kellia looked very much like Kelos did at that time. Still, it could have been coincidence. But I decided to do a little digging. You and "Kellia" showed up after your "mother" died? I had an agent of mine try to find this woman's grave. I don't need to tell you how that search went, do I?"

"No," Ariella replied.

"Still that wasn't absolute proof," Orianna said. "I had a diplomat bribe a maid to get a hair sample from "Kellia" then had Xarlat test it. I don't think I need to tell you how that test turned out either, do I?"

"No, you don't," Ariella replied. "But Kellia is happy like this."

"Happy because of a potion that brainwashed her," Orianna replied. "Maybe she would be okay with things as they are now, but she never got to make that choice. So now I'm going to give you a choice. I'm bringing Kelos back to Grovan with me tonight. You can help me, or oppose me."
1151321112221221211.title: Before the wedding, someone wants to have a spe...

choices: Orianna gives Ariella a magic infused kiss
Orianna stabs herself with the dagger as Fia and/or Kellia walk in
11513211122212212112.content:
Ariella and Orianna both began pacing in a large circle around the room, it was obvious mere words were not going to settle this situation. But Ariella made a final vocal plea anyways, "I don't suppose it would change your mind about the situation if I told you Kellia was the one who dosed herself with the love potion. It wasn't some big evil conspiracy by me or Marlin but your former brother miscalculation."

Orianna paused for the briefest of moments before letting out a harsh laugh, "My this is quite an amusing and appropriate fate for my dear precious brother, sorry, sister. But I still must insist on taking her back to Grovan. Nobody gets to mess with her but me, not even his own stupidity."

"I can respect that. I must say I admire your...passion towards your brother. For the first time in years I actually regret not being Arthras at this moment. I have a feeling the two of us would get along very well."

"As pretty as you are now, I can't say I have a thing against older gentlemen. Especially if they have a kingdom of their own. But it's a few years too late for that. Maybe in another day, another branch of the tree of life it could have happened but not today. Now you are just a silly young girl in the way of me bringing the former Prince Kelos back home."

"Her name is Kellia." With that Ariella and Orianna made their moves. Ariella grabbed a dagger she kept on her thigh at all times and charged at Orianna. Orianna was ready as well, she opened her cloak and two small glass orbs full of liquid at the charging princess. But Ariella had the advantage of having the mind of a fighter and the body of a young woman near her prime and easily dodged the projectiles. Orianna threw a small pocket of a glowing dust in Ariella's direction but Ariella's reflexes were quick enough. The former king closed her eyes and held her breath and got through the dust and just before she opened her eyes she leaped forward and tackled the princess of Grovan to the ground and held the dagger to her throat.

"I will kill anyone who gets in the way of my sister's happiness." Ariella said with a venom in her voice that hadn't been their since he was a king making tough negotiations. But Ariella was trying not to be that person anymore, "But I won't do that. You're doing this out of...I'll believe the best in you and call it love, but I need you to trust me when I say this is what Kellia needs to be happy. Now I'm going to knock you out and take you to Marlin, we'll figure out what to do with you after the wedding."

"Going to kill me and dump me on the side of the road just like 'Arthras' and 'Kellos'?"

Ariella was stunned for a moment. But it was long enough for Orianna to make one last move.
11513211122212212112.title: Ariella and Orianna duel over Kellia's fate

choices: The potions made them both think they were girls!
The potions were different and Mina was transformed!
1151321112221222.content:
"That's weird," Kellia said, as she looked herself over. "Nothing seemed to happen. What was that potion supposed to do?"

"AHHH!" Richard screamed, collapsing to his knees. "What have you done to me, you mean old wizard?!"

"Oh ho, this is an interesting reaction," Marlin said.

"What's wrong?" Kellia asked as she rushed over to Richard's side. She looked him over too, but he seemed okay. She then glared at Marlin. "If you hurt him I'll tell my big sister!"

"He... He..." Richard stammered. "He turned me into a boy!"

"Huh?" Kellia replied, looking confused. "But you are a boy, Richard."

"No I'm not, I'm a girl! He turned me into a boy with his magic!" he insisted, pointing an accusing finger at Marlin. "He said the vials would do the same thing but you're still a girl and I'm a boy and he made me like this. Richard began to tear up.

Kellia was quite confused, as she had known Richard as a boy since they first met. Still, she did her best to comfort him. Clearly Marlin has done something, but what could it be.

"Fascinating, fascinating!" Marlin exclaimed as he made notes about the potion's results. "Kellia doesn't suspect a thing, while Richard is clearly in distress. Clearly the subjects are aware of their current physical state..."

"If you know he's in distress help!" Kellia yelled as she hugged Richard, interrupting the wizard.

"Oh," Marlin said, not realizing he had been speaking out loud. "I'd like to, but I must observe the reactions you two have to the potion more! This is truly fascinating!"

"I don't want to be a boy," Richard sobbed.

"You might find this fascinating, but Richard is crying because of what you did!" Kellia said.

"A week ouch" The now bloody nosed scribe replied.

"Yes sire," then nudging his bruised scribe, "You heard the king, go on, tell him why I'm here."

The prince glared at the scribe, this was not what he was supposed to say.

"So this is the quality of servants in Grovan? No wonder it is such a dreary place," Princess Fia remarked haughtily. "Why I do believe one of your kind would better suited to cleaning the stables than as my handmaiden."

Kela was taken back by the princess' derisive comments. When she had met her as Prince Kelos years before, Princess Fia had been polite and cheerful, a far cry from the woman standing before her today. Was that merely an act at a formal reception and this her true self. Or perhaps she is simply dismissive of servants, not uncommon for nobility, and something the prince himself had been guilty of on occasion. "One of my kind?" Kela asked, hoping the reply would provide illumination on this unexpected side to the princess.

"Do you think me a naive and sheltered girl? You look upon me as a man would. Do not think I am unaware of such things," The princess' previously haughty expression turned to anger. "Perhaps that is why you were sent to me, to test if I am easily tempted to sin? Does Prince Kelos think me a woman of such loose morals?!"

"I wo... Prince Kelos would not dream of putting you to such a test!" Kela replied emphatically.

13211111221.content:
Kela sighed. "I suppose you already figured it out. Yes, I'm actually Prince Kelos. I had an unfortunate encounter with a transformation scroll shortly before arriving."

"Thus you decided to pass yourself off as a servant?" Princess Fia asked. "I must say, this does not seem to be the most well thought out plan I have been privy to, as evidenced by the promptness of your exposure."

"I've been mostly improvising," Kela replied defensively. "I had originally intended to pose as an envoy sent ahead to ensure the situation was suitable for my arrival as Prince Kelos. However, the scribe who was responsible for this situation decided to humiliate me by proclaiming me a servant. Perhaps there was little choice, as your father seemed quite dismissive of a woman speaking to him. Still, I shall make sure he pays for this treachery upon our return to Grovan. I do believe my sister is in need of another maid."

Princess Fia giggled at this thought. "My, that would be a most fitting punishment. I do so apologize for my earlier behavior. I had believed your presence implied certain rumors about me had left the court and traveled as far as your kingdom. I was, after all expecting a prince to ask for my hand in marriage, yet instead I was presented with a handmaiden with a rather obvious attraction to me. It pleases me to know I was mistaken in this assumption. You are not that sort of woman, but simply a man who has become a woman. Though I am curious if Prince Kelos was as handsome a man as Princess Kela is a beautiful woman."

Kela blushed at Princess Fia's compliment. "I would like to think so," she replied. "Though I am somewhat disappointed you do not remember me. We met several years ago, at the wedding of the Duke and Duchess of Eliswick."

"I must again apologize it seems," Princess Fia said. "I'm afraid I was still but a young girl at the time and not terribly interested in potential suitors. Speaking of which, will you be remaining Princess Kela, or will Prince Kelos make a return?"

"I have been told the spell will wear off in one week." Kela answered. "But could you please not call me princess? It's embarrassing and if one of your servants should overhear..."

"Oh, but I appear to only have a short time to do so, Princess Kela. It would be terribly dissatisfying to not take advantage of such an opportunity," Princess Fia stated playfully. "Will you not indulge me for a mere 7 days?"
13211111221.title: Admit your identity and explain what happened.

132111112211.content:
Looking into Princess Fia's eyes, Kela could see the anticipation building as she waited for a response. There was little harm in this, after all the Princess already knew her true identity. If she's looking forward to it this much, what could be done? "Fine, you may call me princess as long as I am in this form." She looked slightly to the side, blushing.

"How wonderful!" Princess Fia exclaimed, grasping Princess Kela's hand with her own, grinning widely. "Oh but I am being rude, please do come sit, Princess Kela." She led the transformed guest over to the window. Underneath was a small, round table made wood. It was painted white and had matching chairs with pink cushions.

Princess Kela looked down at her dress. "I'm not quite sure how to sit in this thing," she said frankly.

"I suppose you would not," Princess Fia replied. "Very well, I shall demonstrate." She walked over to a chair. "First, you must smooth out your dress." She reached behind her rear and did as she was instructing. "Then simply sit straight down, but be graceful. Remember, a proper lady such as ourselves must keep her legs crossed, preferable at the ankle." She sat down.

"I think I can manage that." Princess Kela replied. She copied Princess Fia's movements and sat down.

"Well done. You're a quick study. No one would suspect you anything other than a proper lady, Princess Kela."

"Thank you, I think. I know you intended it as a compliment, but I'm not sure how I feel about being a 'proper lady.'"

"Why you should feel flattered, naturally," Princess Fai replied. She leaned forward and grasped Princess Kela's hand. "After all you are quite a lovely and graceful woman, Princess Kela. I'm positive you shall make the entire court envious of your beauty."

Princess Kela's heart raced, causing her to blush profusely at Princess Fia's words. "T-Thank you," she stuttered.

"Though I must confess, apart from the transformation of the spell, you are not at all what I expected," Princess Fia commented. "I was picturing Grovan's royal family to be far more brutish. I wonder if the spell has not transformed more than your body."

"It didn't stop me from punching that scribe for failing to warn me," Princess Kela stated, her heart claiming somewhat. "I suppose it can not be ruled out, but even if I had not been transformed, I would be on my best behavior. After all, I did come here to make you my bride, Princess."

"I see. A most satisfactory reason I would say,} Princess Fia agreed. "Though I wonder, might it be preferable if I made you my bride? Beauty such as yours can only be fully realized in a bridal gown."

Blush returned to Princess Kela's cheeks as her heart once again raced and she felt an unfamiliar moistness in her crotch. "I-I'm sure my b-beauty doesn't begin to compare to yours! Everyone must have been looking forward to seeing you in a bridal gown. I have been ever since I first saw you."

"You are too modest, Princess Kela," Princess Fia replied. "Though perhaps you do have a point. I would not wish to deprive you of something you have been desiring for so long. We shall be each other's brides then."

"I... I thought you were opposed to that sort of thing," Princess Kela said cautiously.

"That was when I believed you to be servant girl sent to test me," Princess Fia explained. "Now I am aware that despite your current form, you were born a prince. But I do go on. If you will excuse me for a moment, Princess Kela, I shall arrange for some tea to be served." the princess got up and walked out of her room.

"I believe I see the reason behind those rumors she alluded to," Princess Kela thought to herself. "Still, I can't help but feel I'm being caught up in her pace. At this rate even when I do change back I'll be more like her bride. I'll have to be more proactive when she returns. Still, 'Princess Kela?' Princess Fia does seem to enjoy calling me that. If my sister knew, she'd never let me hear the end of this though."

After a few moments, Princess Fia returned. "I do apologize for my delay, Princess Kela."

Kela gracefully rose as she had seen Princess Fia do. "Not at all, Princess."

A maid rushed in behind Princess Fia, carrying a tray of macarons which she placed on the table. She then turned to their guest. "I-I'm terribly sorry for the way we've treated you, Princess Kela!" the maid said, bowing deeply. "We had no idea who your were. Please accept this apology on behalf of the entire castle staff!"

Kela looked over to Princess Fia, shocked. "Wha..."

"I believe it best that the servants not be left under the impression you're a mere handmaiden, Princess Kela." Princess Fia said, explaining herself.

Kela turned back to the maid, blushing from embarrassment. "You're forgiven," she said.

"Thank you so much!' The maid replied. "I'll be back shortly with your tea." The maid backed out of the room, keeping her head down the entire time.

Princess Kela turned to her hostess. "What did you tell them?!" she asked in near panic.

"Why merely the truth, Prince Kelos met with an incident on his trip over, as was claimed upon your arrival, so Princess Kela came in his place. This way we may move about the palace without pretense of your status." Princess Fia smiled warmly.

"You didn't tell them about my condition?" Princess Kela asked.

"Would you have wished me to?" Princess Fia replied.

"Absolutely not!" Princess Kela responded.She stomped her foot and pouted in a rather feminine matter.

Princess Fia raised her finger hand to her mouth and giggled. "I must confess I have not been so amused in quite awhile. I am not sure how I would feel towards Prince Kelos, but I can say I most certainly enjoy your company, Princess Kela."
132111112211.title: Let Princess Fia have her way. You can't se...
